title: Senior Python Developer
description:
We’re Torchbox, a progressive digital agency on a mission to help charities create transformative, high-quality digital products and services in low-risk, cost-effective ways. We’re proud to be the creators of Wagtail, one of the leading open source CMSs, now used by Google, NASA, the NHS and thousands of other organisations around the world.


This is a great time to join Torchbox. We’ve just become the UKs first 100% employee owned digital agency, business is booming in the UK and US, Wagtail is flying high and we’re doing great work with many, incredible, mission-driven organisations.


We’re looking for a Senior Python Developer to join our team! 


You’ll be taking the lead on building web apps for our lovely, interesting clients in the UK, Europe and the US; organisations like the NHS, NASA, Google, Mozilla, Oxfam, the World Food Programme, Médecins Sans Frontières. You'll be helping us improve Wagtail, our open source CMS. We're looking for someone who enjoys working in a multidisciplinary team environment to help solve complex problems.


The basic technical requirements are demonstrable expertise in Python and Django, as well as one or more supporting languages, technologies and frameworks: API development, SPAs, Wagtail, Docker, Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL. But your personal skills are just as important. 


To be successful in this role, you'll be:


  • Confident in communicating with clients to elicit clearly defined requirements and convert these into robust technical architecture.

  • Experienced in producing high-quality technical specifications, documentation and accurately estimating the time required for the build.

  • Confident in contributing to testing strategies and providing high-quality user training.

  • Experienced in producing high-quality code to budget, demonstrating commercial awareness.  

  • Ready to operate as technical lead on projects.

  • Confident in contributing to proposals and pitching successfully.

  • We're looking for someone who can help nurture a strong, happy team. In particular, we want you to:

  • Support your colleagues (teaching, coaching, line managing, mentoring, reviewing and improving code).

  • Remain up to date with developments in your software field and share your knowledge


What we can offer you:


  • The chance to be a partner, not just an employee.  As a co-owner of Torchbox you'll help shape, and share, our success.
  • The chance to work with our brilliant clients, making the world a better place
  • Competitive salary with annual review.
  • Training and conference budget to accelerate your development.
  • Flexible working hours (and location).
  • 25 days annual leave (plus public holidays).
  • Private health cover.
  • Ethical pension scheme, with a 5% contribution from Torchbox
  • A weekly veggie team lunch that brings everyone together (when we’re in the office!)
  • Regular outings and parties including our famous Torchfest!

*The salary range quoted includes our employee owners and performance bonus scheme. This equates to roughly 10% - 25% of your final salary. 

​

We particularly welcome neurodiverse individuals and applicants from ethnically diverse backgrounds that are under-represented groups in the creative and technology industries.


If you need any help completing the application form then please email recruitment@torchbox.com or if you would prefer to apply by phone then give us a call on +44 (0) 1608 811 870




No agencies please.
vacancydescription: Take the lead on building web apps, helping to improve Wagtail and working in a multidisciplinary team environment to solve complex problems.
city: Bristol, Charlbury, US, Philippines and Remote

title: Junior Developer
description:
We’re Torchbox, a progressive digital agency on a mission to help charities create transformative, high-quality digital products and services in low-risk, cost-effective ways. We’re proud to be the creators of Wagtail, one of the leading open source CMSs, now used by Google, NASA, the NHS and thousands of other organisations around the world.

This is a great time to join Torchbox. We’ve just become the UKs first 100% employee owned digital agency, business is booming in the UK and US, Wagtail is flying high and we’re doing great work with many, incredible, mission-driven organisations.

We are looking for Junior Developers to join our team! 

You’ll work alongside talented developers, designers and project managers who will mentor and support your progression.

Please note this role would suit someone who has recently  graduated or looking to begin their career as a Developer. If you’ve got more experience, we have a Developer & Senior Developer role open on our website.

To get the best out of the position you will need: 

  • To know the basics of programming and software engineering. We won’t expect you to know everything but we will expect you to be keen to learn.

  • An understanding of how the web works and the curiosity to delve deeper into it. 

  • To show initiative in problem solving and to communicate what you have already tried when asking for help. 

  • To be comfortable working in a busy team, for multiple clients

  • To share our values

What we can offer you:

  • The opportunity to be a co-owner of Torchbox, shaping and sharing in our success. Be a partner, not just an employee. Our Voice Groups provide the chance to share your vision within Torchbox.

  • The chance to work with our brilliant clients, making the world a better place

  • Competitive salary with annual review with annual employee owners and performance bonus

  • Training and conference budget to accelerate your development.

  • Flexible working hours; the option to work fully remotely, split your time between office and home, or choose to be in one of our offices fulltime, enabling you to work in a flexible way that best suits your needs.

  • Free eye tests, flu jabs & shopping discounts

  • Private health scheme and access to mental health support

  • Ethical pension scheme, with a 5% contribution from Torchbox

  • Wellness programme and cycle to work scheme, alongside other Torchbox offerings, good for both you and the environment.

  • Regular virtual and in-person events, weekly veggie team lunch (when we’re in the office)  & parties including our famous Torchfest

  • 25 days holiday, plus public holidays

*The salary range quoted includes our employee owners and performance bonus scheme. This equates to roughly 10% - 25% of your final salary. 

We particularly welcome neurodiverse individuals and applicants from ethnically diverse backgrounds that are under-represented groups in the creative and technology industries.

If you need any help completing the application form then please email recruitment@torchbox.com or if you would prefer to apply by phone then give us a call on +44 (0) 1608 811 870

No agencies please.

title: UX Consultant
description:
We are Torchbox, a progressive digital agency on a mission to help nonprofits create and market transformative digital products and services. We’re proud to be the creators of Wagtail, one of the leading open source CMSs, used by Google, NASA, the NHS and thousands of other organisations around the world.


This is a great time to join Torchbox. Business is booming in the UK and US, Wagtail is flying high and we’re doing great work with many, incredible, mission-driven organisations.


We’re also the UKs first digital agency to be a 100% Employee-Owned Trust. And, we’re at a pivotal moment, 12 months from paying off our ex-shareholders and grasping the opportunity to become the extraordinary company and place to work that this freedom will give us. And, you can be involved in shaping this.



We’re looking for a UX Consultant to join our team. 


You’ll play a key role in producing high quality digital solutions to real world problems for clients, helping them to improve the user experience of their products and services.  You’ll lead user research projects and use UX design processes to help deliver high quality outputs and real value for our fantastic clients.

You’ll have a deep understanding of UX design and research practices and some understanding of associated disciplines such as service design and content design. You’ll use your knowledge, experience and enthusiasm to help shape our UX team’s direction, and deepen our wider team’s understanding and practice of research and design methodologies.  You’re likely to line-manage or mentor more junior UX practitioners.

You will be joining a UX Design team where you will have the opportunity to make a big impact. We are looking for individuals with initiative that will help drive our UX expertise both on projects, within the team and externally with our marketing team. One day you might be working on shaping a programme of work for our next exciting project, another you’ll be conducting user interviews and user testing, and helping translate user needs into valuable design challenges and opportunities. 


Who we’re looking for

  • Significant experience in user research and user experience design

  • Experience shaping and leading UX research programmes

  • Experience with both qualitative and quantitative research methodologies

  • Someone who loves to shape and facilitate workshops and design sprints

  • A strong communicator, both verbal and written

  • Experience working in an agile environment

  • An aptitude for translating research insights into design opportunities

  • Some experience with prototyping tools such as Sketch and Figma


What we can offer you:

  • The chance to be a partner, not just an employee. As a co-owner of Torchbox you'll help shape, and share, our success.

  • The chance to work with our brilliant clients, making the world a better place

  • Competitive salary with annual review.

  • Training and conference budget to accelerate your development.

  • Flexible working hours (and location).

  • 25 days annual leave (plus public holidays).

  • Private health cover.

  • Ethical pension scheme, with a 5% contribution from Torchbox

  • Plenty of tea, coffee and fruit and a weekly veggie team lunch that brings everyone together (when we’re in the office!)

  • Regular outings and parties including our famous Torchfest!

  • *The salary range quoted includes our employee owners and performance bonus scheme. This equates to roughly 10% - 25% of your final salary. 


We particularly welcome neurodiverse individuals and applicants from ethnically diverse backgrounds that are under-represented groups in the creative and technology industries. We’re currently working remotely, so you can be based anywhere. 

No agencies, please.
vacancydescription: You’ll play a key role in producing high quality digital solutions to real world problems for clients, helping them to improve the user experience of their products and services.  You’ll lead user research projects and use UX design processes to help deliver high quality outputs and real value for our fantastic clients.
city: Bristol, Charlbury, US, Philippines and Remote

title: Product Manager
description:
We’re Torchbox, a progressive digital agency on a mission to create transformative, high-quality products and services in low-risk, cost-effective ways. We’re proud to be the creators of Wagtail, one of the leading open source CMSs, now used by Google, NASA, the NHS and thousands of other organisations around the world.

This is a great time to join Torchbox. We’ve recently become the UKs first 100% employee owned digital agency, business is booming in the UK and US, Wagtail is flying high and we’re doing great work with many, incredible, mission-driven organisations.

We’re looking for a Product Manager to join our team!

The Product Manager plays a leading role in delivering excellence in partnership with the UK Public Sector and world-class not-for-profit organisations Torchbox works with.​You will collaborate with clients to define a clear strategic vision and roadmap for their products - a vision which you will own, champion, and evolve throughout the product life cycle and beyond. By applying our culture, processes and technologies you will direct our multidisciplinary teams to create exceptional solutions which you’re proud of and exceed expectations.

As a senior member of the Torchbox team you will be responsible for the strategic direction of your clients as well as managing and inspiring both internal and client teams:

Product leadership

  • Experience developing products in line with the GOV.UK Service Standard and understanding of governance processes​(e.g spend controls, service assessment, programme boards) is desirable.
  • Experience developing product strategies and directing​a portfolio of clients and their​associated products.
  • Defining and setting the vision and goals for client products in collaboration with the wider team and the client.
  • Leading product discovery to define usable, valuable, viable and feasible solutions.
  • Being responsible for the quality of the products we create and the results they deliver to our clients and their user base.
  • Providing leadership for committed and talented multi-disciplinary teams by bringing energy and enthusiasm to fuel the team and challenge them to do better work.
  • Be the first person clients turn to when they need strategic advice or in the unlikely event something goes wrong. Acting as the point of escalation you’ll professionally diagnose situations, people and context to shape a positive outcome.
  • Ensure our clients enjoy a great experience with, and level of service from our agency and one that reflects its unique culture and ethos.

Business development

  • Work closely with the SMT and the Product Services Director to develop innovative ideas for products and services.
  • Collaborate with the new business team and make an active contribution to winning business by providing expert insight and advice, scoping solutions, and product roadmaps.
  • Spot commercial, innovation or strategic opportunities that develop the agency’s revenue, profile and output.
  • Provide thought leadership on product best practices

Product/Client Management

  • As a specialist in product and client management, you will provide oversight of multiple delivery teams and programmes of product development
  • Be accountable for budget and timeline, working closely with the Delivery Team to identify risks early and mitigate issues before they impact the project or relationship.
  • Be accountable for delivery, working with Delivery Managers to develop and prioritise opportunity and product backlogs.
  • Set objectives and key results in partnership with your clients. You’ll own and monitor these to drive continuous improvement and ensure your clients can demonstrate value for money and impact from our work.
  • Facilitate key planning and ideation sessions and ensure a clear focus on organisational culture, objectives, and product vision.
  • Help clients to develop long term roadmaps for their digital products.
  • Work with agency leads to continuously improve our delivery processes, ensuring we follow best practice.
  • Assume specific responsibilities of a Product Owner or Product Manager where appropriate.

Skills & Experience

  • Track-record of leadership in successful design, delivery and continuous improvement of high-quality products and services which maximise opportunities offered by digital technology.
  • A confident negotiator with close attention to commercial details and contracts.
  • Proven ability to motivate self-organising agile teams, delegate decision making to the most effective level, and empower teams to deliver to the best of their abilities.
  • You will have experience maintaining a delivery team’s focus on delivering value, balancing multiple streams of requirements so that they can concentrate on what they do best: creating a great product!
  • You'll be good at shaping projects from loose or undefined requirements.  You'll head up major product development initiatives, leading early-stage discovery to refine vision, set and benchmark objectives, oversee research programmes, and influence stakeholders.
  • An independent strategic thinker able to identify and create opportunities to build long term trusted relationships with clients.
  • A confident presenter with the ability to engage with your audience.
  • Ability to set realistic budgets, expectations and timescales, and deliver against them.  
  • Strong leadership and communication skills.  
  • Ability to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to client projects, as well as developing these skills in a larger team.
  • Be digitally literate and a confident communicator across a broad spectrum of specialisms; from user experience and content strategy to content management and technical integrations.


What we can offer you:


  • The chance to be a partner, not just an employee.  As a co-owner of Torchbox you'll help shape, and share, our success.
  • The chance to work with our brilliant clients, making the world a better place
  • Competitive salary with annual review.
  • Training and conference budget to accelerate your development.
  • Flexible working hours (and location).
  • 25 days annual leave (plus public holidays).
  • Private health cover.
  • Ethical pension scheme, with a 5% contribution from Torchbox
  • A weekly veggie team lunch that brings everyone together (when we’re in the office!)
  • Regular outings and parties including our famous Torchfest!

*The salary range quoted includes our employee owners and performance bonus scheme. This equates to roughly 10% - 25% of your final salary. 

​

We particularly welcome neurodiverse individuals and applicants from ethnically diverse backgrounds that are under-represented groups in the creative and technology industries.


If you need any help completing the application form then please email recruitment@torchbox.com or if you would prefer to apply by phone then give us a call on +44 (0) 1608 811 870



No agencies please.

You will collaborate with clients to define a clear strategic vision and roadmap for their products - a vision which you will own, champion, and evolve throughout the product life cycle and beyond.

title: Python Developer
description:
We’re Torchbox, a progressive digital agency on a mission to help charities create transformative, high-quality digital products and services in low-risk, cost-effective ways. We’re proud to be the creators of Wagtail, one of the leading open source CMSs, now used by Google, NASA, the NHS and thousands of other organisations around the world.


This is a great time to join Torchbox. We’ve just become the UKs first 100% employee owned digital agency, business is booming in the UK and US, Wagtail is flying high and we’re doing great work with many, incredible, mission-driven organisations.


We are looking for a Python Developer to join our team!


You’ll be building web apps for our lovely, interesting clients in the UK, Europe and the US; organisations like the NHS, NASA, Google, Mozilla, Oxfam, the World Food Programme, Médecins Sans Frontières. You'll be helping us improve Wagtail, our open source CMS. We're looking for someone who enjoys working in a multidisciplinary team environment to help solve complex problems.

The basic technical requirements are demonstrable expertise in Python and Django, as well as one or more supporting languages, technologies and frameworks: API development, SPAs, Wagtail, Docker, Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL. But your personal skills are just as important.


To be successful in this role, you’ll:

  • Be able to consistently deliver robust, bug free, well documented software.  

  • Be able to manually end-to-end test software that has been written to uncover any edge case / data related bugs (i.e. test as a user of the software) and analyse and improve the performance of a piece of software. 

  • Be comfortable with DevOps processes; able to set up staging and production environments.

  • Adhere to and promote adherence to agreed software development practices within the team and help to identify areas of improvement for a team or a project and can constructively voice solutions.

  • Be able to estimate time required for build of a feature and consistently deliver features within estimates and take responsibility for the quality of code in a project outside of your immediate remit. 

  • Participate in educational opportunities in your own field, remaining up to date with state-of-the-art developments, and sharing learning and ideas. 

  • Contribute to proposals by providing advice and information and may be asked to participate in a pitch.

  • Have excellent written, spoken and presentational communication skills. 

  • Understand the concept of agile development and sprints as implemented by Torchbox; participate actively in project ceremonies.

  • Able to manage your time effectively, demonstrating an awareness of deadlines. 

  • Proactively communicate with colleagues and update project managers on a project.

  • Be able to participate usefully in a client workshop e.g. story mapping, or any other requirements gathering exercise.

  • Be able to communicate effectively with clients to elicit detailed but clearly defined requirements for features.

  • Have a strong focus on quality and budget.


What we can offer you: 

  • The opportunity to be a co-owner of Torchbox, shaping and sharing in our success. Be a partner, not just an employee. Our Voice Groups provide the chance to share your vision within Torchbox.

  • The chance to work with our brilliant clients, making the world a better place.

  • Competitive salary with annual review & annual employee owners and performance bonus.

  • Training and conference budget to accelerate your development.

  • Flexible working hours; the option to work fully remotely, split your time between office and home, or choose to be in one of our offices fulltime, enabling you to work in a flexible way that best suits your needs.

  • Private health scheme.

  • Ethical pension scheme.

  • Wellness programme alongside other Torchbox offerings, good for both you and the environment.

  • Regular virtual and in-person events & parties including our famous Torchfest.

  • 25 days holiday, plus public holidays.

*The salary range quoted includes our employee owners and performance bonus scheme. This equates to roughly 10% - 25% of your final salary. 


We particularly welcome neurodiverse individuals and applicants from ethnically diverse backgrounds that are under-represented groups in the creative and technology industries.


If you need any help completing the application form then please email recruitment@torchbox.com or if you would prefer to apply by phone then give us a call on +44 (0) 1608 811 870


No agencies please.

title: Wagtail Developer
description:
We’re Torchbox, a progressive digital agency on a mission to help charities create transformative, high-quality digital products and services in low-risk, cost-effective ways. We’re proud to be the creators of Wagtail, one of the leading open source CMSs, now used by Google, NASA, the NHS and thousands of other organisations around the world.


This is a great time to join Torchbox. We’ve just become the UKs first 100% employee owned digital agency, business is booming in the UK and US, Wagtail is flying high and we’re doing great work with many, incredible, mission-driven organisations.


We are looking for a Wagtail Developer to join our team to help to improve Wagtail!


Wagtail is an open source CMS that powers some of the biggest and most prestigious websites in the world. We are hiring a developer to accelerate the pace of product development at Wagtail in order to reach the vision for 2023. 

By joining our Wagtail product team you’ll learn from the likes of Django Fellows gasman and tomdyson, as well as Wagtail legend kaedroho. You’ll spend your time improving Wagtail and using your expertise to help others. Responsibilities include:

  • Assisting in the development of Wagtail's technical roadmap

  • Working with designers and product managers to explore and solve complex problems

  • Building new features (e.g. workflow, commenting)

  • Working on sprints focused on tech debt and code restructuring

  • Helping to review merge requests submitted by the community

  • Providing expert consulting to Wagtail Support clients

  • Assisting in the preparation of quarterly releases

For this role we’re looking for someone with the following skills:

Must have:

  • Excellent Python and Django skills

  • Experience writing clear documentation

  • Fun to work with, great teamwork and collaboration skills

Should have:

  • Experience prioritising your own workload

  • Expertise in git and branch management

  • Ability to quickly understand existing codebases

Nice to have:

  • Experience developing with React

  • Previous contributions to open source projects

  • Experience building sites with Wagtail


What we can offer you:

  • The opportunity to be a co-owner of Torchbox, shaping and sharing in our success. Be a partner, not just an employee. Our Voice Groups provide the chance to share your vision within Torchbox.

  • ​The chance to work with our brilliant clients, making the world a better place.

  • Competitive salary with annual review and annual employee owners and performance bonus.

  • Training and conference budget to accelerate your development.

  • Flexible working hours; the option to work fully remotely, split your time between office and home, or choose to be in one of our offices fulltime, enabling you to work in a flexible way that best suits your needs.

  • Free eye tests, flu jabs & shopping discounts.

  • Private health scheme and access to mental health support.

  • Ethical pension scheme, with a 5% contribution from Torchbox.

  • ​Wellness programme and cycle to work scheme, alongside other Torchbox offerings, good for both you and the environment.

  • Regular virtual and in-person events, weekly veggie team lunch (when we’re in the office)  & parties including our famous Torchfest.

  • 25 days holiday, plus public holidays.


*The salary range quoted includes our employee owners and performance bonus scheme. This equates to roughly 10% - 25% of your final salary. 

​

We particularly welcome neurodiverse individuals and applicants from ethnically diverse backgrounds that are under-represented groups in the creative and technology industries.


If you need any help completing the application form then please email recruitment@torchbox.com or if you would prefer to apply by phone then give us a call on +44 (0) 1608 811 870

No agencies please.

title: Paid Media Account Manager
description:
We’re Torchbox, the leading digital marketing agency for UK and international nonprofits. We’re proud to provide digital marketing services to the NHS, Breast Cancer Now, Great Ormond Street Hospital, Samaritans, Mind, Girlguiding, MS Society, Oxfam GB and many, many more charities and organisations around the world. 

This is a great time to join Torchbox. We’ve just become the UKs first 100% employee owned digital agency, business is booming in the UK and US, we’re winning awards and we’re doing great work with many incredible, mission-driven organisations. 

We are looking for a ​Paid Media Account Manager to join our award winning team!

You’ll be planning, running and reporting back on pay-per-click (PPC) and paid social media campaigns for some of the very biggest charities and NGOs.

Your responsibilities will include: 

  • Devising, running and optimising PPC and paid social campaigns with significant budgets. 

  • Delivering monthly reports to our clients using Google Analytics as your primary measurement tool. 

  • Building long-term relationships without clients through regular face-to-face remote meetings.

  • Supporting our Head of Digital Acquisition in contributing to new business pitches and proposals. Occasionally, you will lead on pitches. 

Our Paid Media Account Managers  have the following skills: 

Essential

  • Significant hands-on experience planning and running PPC and paid social campaigns. You’ll be able to point to campaigns you’ve managed that have delivered outstanding results, and on day one at Torchbox, you will be able to independently set up, optimise and report back on Google Ads, Facebook and other paid media campaigns. 

  • An excellent understanding of the digital marketing landscape—while you might not have run campaigns on Twitter, LinkedIn or YouTube, you’ll know what they’re for and be able to confidently recommend their use to clients. 

  • Outstanding client-facing skills. This is a client-facing role, so you’ll be talking to our charities every day on Zoom, and responding to their requests quickly via email and various project management tools.

  • Experience managing multiple projects or accounts concurrently. You will be looking after between 5 and 10 clients, so the ability to juggle workload, quickly switch focus and manage your own time against tight deadlines is essential. 

  • Strong account management skills. You will be responsible for looking after our clients and making sure they’re happy with the work Torchbox delivered. 

  • A working knowledge of Google Analytics. You will be comfortable logging in and using it to report back on the success of your marketing campaigns.

  • Outstanding, error-free written skills. We need to communicate clearly and accurately with our clients, so you’ll need to display attention to detail. 

  • Excellent numerical skills. You will be managing and moving budgets all day every day in response to campaign performance, so you’ll need to know Google Sheets (or Excel). 

Desirable

  • Experience working agency-side.

  • Experience running email marketing campaigns

  • Organic social media experience

  • A background in the nonprofit sector.

  • Experience managing Google Ad Grants accounts.

  • Experience advertising on LinkedIn, Twitter, YouTube and Display Channels.

What we can offer you:

  • The opportunity to be a co-owner of Torchbox, shaping and sharing in our success. Be a partner, not just an employee. Our Voice Groups provide the chance to share your vision within Torchbox.

  • The chance to work with our brilliant clients, making the world a better place

  • Competitive salary with annual review with annual employee owners and performance bonus

  • Training and conference budget to accelerate your development.

  • Flexible working hours; the option to work fully remotely, split your time between office and home, or choose to be in one of our offices fulltime, enabling you to work in a flexible way that best suits your needs.

  • Free eye tests, flu jabs & shopping discounts

  • Private health scheme and access to mental health support

  • Ethical pension scheme, with a 5% contribution from Torchbox

  • Wellness programme and cycle to work scheme, alongside other Torchbox offerings, good for both you and the environment.

  • Regular virtual and in-person events, weekly veggie team lunch (when we’re in the office)  & parties including our famous Torchfest

  • 25 days holiday, plus public holidays

*The salary range quoted includes our employee owners and performance bonus scheme. This equates to roughly 10% - 25% of your final salary. 

We particularly welcome neurodiverse individuals and applicants from ethnically diverse backgrounds that are under-represented groups in the creative and technology industries.

If you need any help completing the application form then please email recruitment@torchbox.com or if you would prefer to apply by phone then give us a call on +44 (0) 1608 811 870

No agencies please.

title: Senior Paid Media Executive
description:
We’re Torchbox, the leading digital marketing agency for UK and international nonprofits. We’re proud to provide digital marketing services to the NHS, Breast Cancer Now, Great Ormond Street Hospital, Samaritans, Mind, Girlguiding, MS Society, Oxfam GB and many, many more charities and organisations around the world. 

This is a great time to join Torchbox. We’ve just become the UKs first 100% employee owned digital agency, business is booming in the UK and US, we’re winning awards and we’re doing great work with many incredible, mission-driven organisations. 

We are looking for a Paid Media Executive to join our award-winning digital marketing team!

 You’ll be running and reporting back on pay-per-click (PPC) and paid social media campaigns for some of the very biggest charities and NGOs. 

This role would suit someone with a few years experience working in a hands-on digital marketing role who is looking to work with organisations who make the world a better place. 

Your responsibilities will include: 

  • Setting up, running and optimising PPC and paid social campaigns.

  • Drafting reports to our clients using Google Analytics as your primary measurement tool. 

  • Supporting our Paid Media Account Managers in the delivery of digital marketing campaigns.

  • Working with our Account Managers to maintain existing client relationships.

Our Paid Media Account Managers  have the following skills: 

Essential

  • Some hands-on experience planning and running PPC and paid social campaigns. You will ideally be able to set up, optimise and report back on Google Ads and Facebook campaigns from day one. 

  • Outstanding client-facing skills. This is a client-facing role, so you’ll be talking to our charities every day on Zoom, and responding to their requests quickly via email and various project management tools.

  • Experience managing multiple projects or accounts concurrently. You will be looking after between 5 and 10 clients, so the ability to juggle workload, quickly switch focus and manage your own time against tight deadlines is essential. 

  • A basic knowledge of Google Analytics. You will be comfortable logging in and using it to report back on the success of your marketing campaigns.

  • Outstanding, error-free written skills. We need to communicate clearly and accurately with our clients, so you’ll need to display attention to detail. 

  • Excellent numerical skills. You will be managing and moving budgets all day every day in response to campaign performance, so you’ll need to know Google Sheets (or Excel). 

Desirable

  • Experience working agency-side.

  • A background in the nonprofit sector.

What we can offer you:

  • The opportunity to be a co-owner of Torchbox, shaping and sharing in our success. Be a partner, not just an employee. Our Voice Groups provide the chance to share your vision within Torchbox.

  • The chance to work with our brilliant clients, making the world a better place

  • Competitive salary with annual review with annual employee owners and performance bonus

  • Training and conference budget to accelerate your development.

  • Flexible working hours; the option to work fully remotely, split your time between office and home, or choose to be in one of our offices fulltime, enabling you to work in a flexible way that best suits your needs.

  • Free eye tests, flu jabs & shopping discounts

  • Private health scheme and access to mental health support

  • Ethical pension scheme, with a 5% contribution from Torchbox

  • Wellness programme and cycle to work scheme, alongside other Torchbox offerings, good for both you and the environment.

  • Regular virtual and in-person events, weekly veggie team lunch (when we’re in the office)  & parties including our famous Torchfest

  • 25 days holiday, plus public holidays

*The salary range quoted includes our employee owners and performance bonus scheme. This equates to roughly 10% - 25% of your final salary. 

We particularly welcome neurodiverse individuals and applicants from ethnically diverse backgrounds that are under-represented groups in the creative and technology industries.

If you need any help completing the application form then please email recruitment@torchbox.com or if you would prefer to apply by phone then give us a call on +44 (0) 1608 811 870

vacancydescription: You’ll be running and reporting back on pay-per-click (PPC) and paid social media campaigns for some of the very biggest charities and NGOs.
city: Bristol, Charlbury, US, Philippines and Remote

title: Wagtail Partnership and Community Manager
description:
We’re Torchbox, a progressive, 100% employee owned digital product and marketing agency for the nonprofit sector. We’re the founding developers of Wagtail, lead the global open source project and most of Wagtail’s product development.

We’re on the look out for a dynamic partnerships and community manager to help deliver the next phase of Wagtail’s growth. It’s a great time to join the team! We have new products in the pipeline, an exciting roadmap of Wagtail enhancements and improvements and an active ecosystem of sponsors and community contributors.

This is a new role and we want to work with the right person to input into the job spec, but broadly we see you:

  • Becoming a key figure and voice of the Wagtail community.

  • Helping deliver product demos and presentations to potential Wagtail users, partners and sponsors.

  • Taking a leading role to produce and share exciting content.

  • Managing and contributing to our Wagtail events - including our popular What’s New in Wagtail webinar and the Wagtail Space conference.

  • Developing and nurturing Wagtail ‘communities of practice’ - e.g non-profits in the UK, higher education organisations in the US.

  • Creating and developing mutually beneficial partnerships with other technology providers and Wagtail agencies.

  • Helping grow our Wagtail developer support service and bringing new products and services to market like Wagtail training and a new SaaS Wagtail product.

  • Improving and managing the Wagtail.io marketing website and other third party platforms so they deliver maximum impact for new and existing customers.

Our Wagtail Partnerships and Community Manager will have the following skills: 

  • Be familiar with Wagtail, open-source software & tech communities.

  • Have an understanding of the technology - so if you have a product or development background that would be a massive plus.

  • Worked in a partnerships, marketing or community role before in the digital or SaaS space.

  • Have excellent written communication skills and ideally you’ll already have experience writing high-quality content.

  • Be a self-starter, able to work independently and hungry to find exciting new partnership opportunities. 

  • Thrive under pressure and enjoy working in a high-tempo environment.

  • Be passionate about working with people and organisations who make the world a better place.


What we can offer you:

  • The opportunity to be a co-owner of Torchbox, shaping and sharing in our success. Be a partner, not just an employee. Our Voice Groups provide the chance to share your vision within Torchbox.

  • The chance to work with our brilliant clients, making the world a better place

  • Competitive salary with annual review with annual employee owners and performance bonus

  • Training and conference budget to accelerate your development.

  • Flexible working hours; the option to work fully remotely, split your time between office and home, or choose to be in one of our offices fulltime, enabling you to work in a flexible way that best suits your needs.

  • Free eye tests, flu jabs & shopping discounts

  • Private health scheme and access to mental health support

  • Ethical pension scheme, with a 5% contribution from Torchbox

  • Wellness programme and cycle to work scheme, alongside other Torchbox offerings, good for both you and the environment.

  • Regular virtual and in-person events, weekly veggie team lunch (when we’re in the office)  & parties including our famous Torchfest

  • 25 days holiday, plus public holidays

*The salary range quoted includes our employee owners and performance bonus scheme. This equates to roughly 10% - 25% of your final salary. If you are based in the US please get in touch to discuss salary bands.

We particularly welcome neurodiverse individuals and applicants from ethnically diverse backgrounds that are under-represented groups in the creative and technology industries.

If you need any help completing the application form then please email recruitment@torchbox.com or if you would prefer to apply by phone then give us a call on +44 (0) 1608 811 870

No agencies please.

reference: Wagtail Partnership and Community Manager - December 2021

title: Head of People
description:
We’re Torchbox, a progressive digital agency on a mission to help non profits create transformative, high-quality digital products and services. We’re proud to be the creators of Wagtail, one of the leading open source CMSs, now used by Google, NASA, the NHS and thousands of other organisations around the world.

This is a great time to join Torchbox. We’re  the UKs first 100% employee owned digital agency, business is booming in the UK and US, Wagtail is flying high and we’re doing great work with many, incredible, mission-driven organisations.

We are looking for a Head of People to join our team!

We’re mission driven. We care about lots of different issues, but more than anything we care about our people, which is why we need you. We are 100% employee owned and at a pivotal moment; we’re 6 months from paying off our ex-shareholders and we have the opportunity to become an extraordinary place to work thanks to this ‘financial freedom’. You will be a  key person in shaping this future.

We’re already a great place to work, but we can be better. In particular by being better at developing our people. At Torchbox we’re ambitious about everyone reaching their full potential and having incredible, satisfying careers which is why this is the right time to take on a Head of People.

Our Head of People will: 

  • Be able to evolve the development and management of our people in a remote, hybrid, multinational, multi-disciplinary context; to further build and retain our amazing team, and to help create an incredible culture that is stand-out even amongst employee-owned businesses. 

  • Be excited to innovate line management, personal development, continuous feedback, training and hiring.  Be full of ideas of how to achieve this, as well as being up to date with the latest tools and how they can help. And  you’ll have a track record to show that you’ve either done it before, or seen it happen and are ready to oversee it yourself.

What you’ll do: 

  • Lead the people function across the business. Work with the SMTs of the three business propositions, the team leads and reports directly to the MD. 

  • Be a valuable contributor to the development and implementation of the business strategy

  • Develop and implement new people initiatives

  • Advise senior management teams on legal issues and best practices around employment

  • Oversee remuneration & benefits

  • Supervise and line managing our People function

  • Identify and measure KPIs for our People function

  • Ensure that the business lives by its values

  • Develop and implement training for employees

  • Evolve our processes for evaluating performance and giving feedback

  • Improve line management and personal development perhaps by growing coaching and mentoring capabilities and maximising the opportunity for personal development planning provided by our competency framework and other tools. 

  • Help to create an environment that works for our employees around the world, from Manila to Monaco.

  • You’ll help to evolve our policies around diversity and inclusion, recruitment, workplace respect and more.

What we can offer you:

  • The opportunity to be a co-owner of Torchbox, shaping and sharing in our success. Be a partner, not just an employee. Our Voice Groups provide the chance to share your vision within Torchbox.

  • The chance to work with our brilliant clients, making the world a better place

  • Competitive salary with annual review with annual employee owners and performance bonus

  • Training and conference budget to accelerate your development.

  • Flexible working hours; the option to work fully remotely, split your time between office and home, or choose to be in one of our offices fulltime, enabling you to work in a flexible way that best suits your needs.

  • Free eye tests, flu jabs & shopping discounts

  • Private health scheme and access to mental health support

  • Ethical pension scheme, with a 5% contribution from Torchbox

  • Wellness programme and cycle to work scheme, alongside other Torchbox offerings, good for both you and the environment.

  • Regular virtual and in-person events, weekly veggie team lunch (when we’re in the office)  & parties including our famous Torchfest

  • 25 days holiday, plus public holidays

*The salary range quoted includes our employee owners and performance bonus scheme. 

We particularly welcome neurodiverse individuals and applicants from ethnically diverse backgrounds that are under-represented groups in the creative and technology industries.

If you need any help completing the application form then please email recruitment@torchbox.com or if you would prefer to apply by phone then give us a call on +44 (0) 1608 811 870

No agencies please.
